headline: Coinbase Urges US Treasury to Avoid Overreach in GENIUS Act Rulemaking

headline: The Top 5 Analyst Questions From Coinbase’s Q3 Earnings Call
summary: Coinbase’s third quarter was marked by outperformance relative to Wall Street’s expectations, as the company delivered robust growth in both revenue and adjusted profitability. Management attributed these results to broad-based expansion across its trading platform, particularly through the rollout of new derivatives products and the integration of decentralized exchange (DEX) assets. headline: Crypto Weekly: Robinhood flies, bitcoin recovers
summary:
STORY: From Robinhood's heights to bitcoin's falls... This is Crypto Weekly.

:: Crypto Weekly

::  Retail investors drive up volumes

Robinhood Markets topped third-quarter profit estimates as retail traders shrugged off bubble fears.

The California-based company's profit nearly quadrupled to $556 million for the period.

Investors drove up trading volumes in crypto, options and equities.

The online brokerage also announced the retirement of its longtime finance chief.

:: Ireland fines Coinbase

The Irish central bank has fined cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase Europe, which is part of the Coinbase Global group, over $25 million.

It's for breaching monitoriing obligations relating to anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism.

:: Ripple rallies

Crypto firm Ripple says it's raised $500 million in a strategic investment valuing it at $40 billion.

It said the investment comes on the heels of Ripple's $1 billion tender offer earlier this year at the same valuation.

In the wake of the U.S. GENIUS Act, which created a regulatory framework for stablecoins, more institutions are adopting stablecoins such as Ripple USD.

:: Bank of England's stablecoin plea

Bank of England deputy governor Sarah Breeden has said it's ‘important' the U.S. and UK are synchronised on stablecoin regulation.

Breeden’s comments come less than a week before the central bank is due to launch a consultation on regulating stablecoins. 

:: Bitcoin recovers

Leading cryptocurrency bitcoin recovered on Wednesday, gaining over 4% .

It bounced back a day after sliding below $99,000 for the first time since June.

Investors shifted away from riskier assets amid a U.S. government shutdown and ongoing worries about weakness in the labor market.

STORY: From Robinhood's heights to bitcoin's falls... This is Crypto Weekly.

:: Crypto Weekly

::  Retail investors drive up volumes

Robinhood Markets topped third-quarter profit estimates as retail traders shrugged off bubble fears.

The California-based company's profit nearly quadrupled to $556 million for the period.

Investors drove up trading volumes in crypto, options and equities.

The online brokerage also announced the retirement of its longtime finance chief.

:: Ireland fines Coinbase

The Irish central bank has fined cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase Europe, which is part of the Coinbase Global group, over $25 million.

It's for breaching monitoriing obligations relating to anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism.

:: Ripple rallies

Crypto firm Ripple says it's raised $500 million in a strategic investment valuing it at $40 billion.

It said the investment comes on the heels of Ripple's $1 billion tender offer earlier this year at the same valuation.

In the wake of the U.S. GENIUS Act, which created a regulatory framework for stablecoins, more institutions are adopting stablecoins such as Ripple USD.

:: Bank of England's stablecoin plea

Bank of England deputy governor Sarah Breeden has said it's ‘important' the U.S. and UK are synchronised on stablecoin regulation.

Breeden’s comments come less than a week before the central bank is due to launch a consultation on regulating stablecoins.

Leading cryptocurrency bitcoin recovered on Wednesday, gaining over 4% .

It bounced back a day after sliding below $99,000 for the first time since June.

Investors shifted away from riskier assets amid a U.S. government shutdown and ongoing worries about weakness in the labor market.

headline: Central Bank of Ireland Fines Coinbase $24.6M for Anti-Money Laundering Failures
summary: The penalty relates to Coinbase Europe breaching its anti-money laundering and counter terrorist financing transaction monitoring obligations between 2021 and 2025.

content.title: Central Bank of Ireland Fines Coinbase $24.6M for Anti-Money Laundering Failures

headline: Crypto giant Coinbase fined in Ireland for rule breaches
summary: Ireland's central bank imposed a fine of 21.5 million euros ($24.7 million) Thursday on crypto giant Coinbase over transaction monitoring failures, including some potentially linked to criminal activities.The company is accused of a "failure to monitor over 30 million transactions" over a year, amounting to 176 billion euros and approximately a third of the transfers carried out by Coinbase Europe Limited (CEBL), the central bank said in a statement.
